item.title: Sidney Crosby out of Penguins-Bruins game after skating in warmup; no reason given for scratch
item.description:
PITTSBURGH, Pa. - Sidney Crosby has been scratched from the lineup shortly before the Pittsburgh Penguins played the Boston Bruins.
He participated in Saturday's pregame warmup but did not return for the start of the game. There was no immedi...

item.title: Crosby late scratch for Penguins; Malkin injured
item.description:
PITTSBURGH -- Pittsburgh Penguins centers Sidney Crosby and Evgeni Malkin are not playing against the Boston Bruins on Saturday.
Crosby participated in Pittsburgh’s warm-ups and was listed in its lineup before being named a late scratch. Forwar...

item.title: WHL Roundup: Nickles nets two, Comrie makes 36 saves as Americans down Cougars
item.description:
KENNEWICK, Wash. - Lucas Nickles scored twice and Eric Comrie turned aside 36 shots as the Tri-City Americans downed the Prince George Cougars 7-4 on Friday night in Western Hockey League action.

item.title: OHL Roundup: Salituro scores two on power play as 67's edge Generals
item.description:
OTTAWA - Dante Salituro scored both of Ottawa's goals on the power play as the 67's slipped past the Oshawa Generals 2-1 on Friday night in Ontario Hockey League action.
The win also snaps a four-game losing skid for Ottawa (35-24-5).
Tobi...

item.title: Friday's NHL Capsules
item.description:
UNIONDALE, N.Y. - Matt Puempel and Kyle Turris scored second-period goals, and backup Andrew Hammond made 34 saves as the Ottawa Senators beat the New York Islanders 2-1 on Friday night.
Ottawa improved to 9-1-1 in its last 11 games to remain...

item.title: Sean Monahan scores twice, leads Flames to 6-3 win over Maple Leafs
item.description:
CALGARY - Red-hot Sean Monahan scored his 26th and 27th goals in his first career three-point game as the Calgary Flames used a four-goal first period to beat the Toronto Maple Leafs 6-3 on Friday.
The 20-year-old sophomore has 10 goals in h...

item.title: QMJHL Roundup: Sullivan stops 48 shots to lead Screaming Eagles over Islanders
item.description:
CHARLOTTETOWN - Miguel Sullivan turned aside 48 shots as the Cape Breton Screaming Eagles got past the Charlottetown Islanders 5-3 on Friday night in Quebec Major Junior Hockey League action.

item.title: MacDonald stops 26 shots as Bulldogs double up Americans 4-2
item.description:
ROCHESTER, N.Y. - Joey MacDonald made 26 saves as the Hamilton Bulldogs doubled up the host Rochester Americans 4-2 on Friday in American Hockey League action.
Daniel Carr, Jake Dowell, Christian Thomas and Eric Tangradi supplied the offence ...

item.title: Wennberg has shootout winner and 2 assists in Blue Jackets' 5-4 comeback victory over Oilers
item.description:
COLUMBUS, Ohio - Alexander Wennberg scored the winning goal in the fifth round of the shootout to lift the Columbus Blue Jackets to a 5-4 victory over the Edmonton Oilers on Friday night.
Wennberg, who scored his first NHL shootout goal on hi...

item.title: Fiddler has goal, assist; Stars score 3 on power play to beat Capitals 4-2
item.description:
WASHINGTON - Vernon Fiddler notched a goal and an assist, and the Dallas Stars scored three power-play goals to beat the Washington Capitals 4-2 on Friday night.
Shawn Horcoff and Tyler Seguin also had man-advantage goals, and Colton Sceviour...

item.title: Jordan Hill scores in overtime as IceCaps edge Monarchs 5-4
item.description:
ST. JOHN'S, N.L. - Jordan Hill's first goal of the season came 1:17 into overtime as the St. John's IceCaps slipped past the visiting Manchester Monarchs 5-4 on Friday in American Hockey League action.
Jason Jaffray struck twice for the IceCa...

item.title: "Embarrassed" Maple Leaf Kadri says he's learned from three-game suspension
item.description:
CALGARY - Nazem Kadri will be ready to move on after missing three straight games for disciplinary reasons.
The Toronto Maple Leafs forward accompanied the team to Calgary on Friday, where he was to sit out his third consecutive game since mi...

item.title: NHL suspends Blackhawks F Nordstrom for 2 games for boarding Coyotes D Ekman-Larsson
item.description:
NEW YORK, N.Y. - The NHL has suspended Chicago Blackhawks forward Joakim Nordstrom for two games for an illegal hit on Arizona Coyotes defenceman Oliver Ekman-Larsson.
The league announced the punishment Friday. Nordstrom also loses $6,631 in...

item.title: Chicago's Nordstrom banned two games for boarding
item.description: NEW YORK – Chicago Blackhawks forward Joakim Nordstrom has been suspended for two games, without pay, for boarding Arizona Coyotes defenseman Oliver Ekman-Larsson during NHL Game No. 1011 in Glendale, Ariz., on Thursday, March 12, the National Hoc...

item.title: Vancouver to host '16 CHL/NHL Top Prospects Game
item.description: The top prospects from the Canadian Hockey League eligible for the 2016 NHL Draft will get an opportunity to showcase their ability before hundreds of NHL scouts at the 2016 CHL/NHL Top Prospects Game at Pacific Coliseum in Vancouver on Jan. 28, 2...

item.title: Kadri: 'Lesson learned' from Maple Leafs discipline
item.description:
CALGARY -- Nazem Kadri is ready to turn the page.
The Toronto Maple Leafs forward, who will sit out his third straight game Friday for disciplinary reasons after being sent home Sunday by coach Peter Horachek for missing a team meeting, has cha...

item.title: Blackhawks' Nordstrom faces Player Safety hearing
item.description:
Chicago Blackhawks forward Joakim Nordstrom will have a hearing Friday with the NHL Department for Player Safety for boarding Arizona Coyotes defenseman Oliver Ekman-Larsson during a game at Gila River Arena on Thursday.
Ekman-Larsson was hit b...

item.title: Jets defenseman Ellerby recalled from AHL
item.description:
The Winnipeg Jets announced they have recalled defenseman Keaton Ellerby from the St. John's IceCaps of the American Hockey League.
Ellerby, 26, has played in 41 games this season with the IceCaps collecting 16 points and 32 penalty minutes. Th...

item.title: Bruins sign forward Vatrano to entry-level contract
item.description:
Boston, MA - Boston Bruins General Manager Peter Chiarelli announced today, March 13, that the club has signed UMass-Amherst forward Frank Vatrano to an entry-level contract. Vatrano will report to the Providence Bruins.
Vatrano finished up his...

item.title: Otters winger Alex Debrincat making a name for himself in rookie season
item.description:
Alex Debrincat was passed over twice in the OHL draft before joining the Erie Otters as a free agent last spring.
He's made the teams who decided not to take a chance on him regret it.
The five-foot-seven 160-pound American is the top-scor...

item.title: Goalie Price drawing Hart Trophy attention as low-scoring Canadiens rise to top
item.description:
MONTREAL - Even those reluctant to give goaltenders their vote for the Hart Trophy are having to reconsider with the season Carey Price is having for the Montreal Canadiens.
Some coaches, including Washington's Barry Trotz and Florida's Gerar...

item.title: Richards, Shaw score power-play goals in Blackhawks' 2-1 win over Coyotes
item.description:

item.title: Elliott earns shutout, then picks up win in shootout as Blues edge Flyers
item.description:
ST. LOUIS - Brian Elliott didn't want to blink.
The St. Louis goalie and Steve Mason, his Philadelphia counterpart, both earned shutouts on Thursday night. Elliott also came away with a win as the host Blues edged the Flyers 1-0 in a shootout...

item.title: Thursday's NHL Capsules
item.description:
BOSTON - Patrice Bergeron and Brad Marchand scored shootout goals to lift the Boston Bruins to a 3-2 victory over the Tampa Bay Lightning on Thursday night.
Boston beat Tampa Bay for the 10th straight time, the longest active slide for a Brui...

item.title: Semyon Varlamov back to full health, leads Avalanche to 2-1 shootout win over Devils
item.description:
DENVER - Jarome Iginla scored in the second period and got the decisive goal in the shootout, Semyon Varlamov stopped 23 shots and the Colorado Avalanche beat the New Jersey Devils 2-1 on Thursday night.
The Avs are now 1-1 on a pivotal three...

item.title: Elliott earns shutout, then picks up win in shootout as Blues edge Flyers
item.description:
ST. LOUIS - Columbus' Brian Elliott and Philadelphia's Steve Mason both earned shutouts, but Elliott picked up the win in a shootout as the host Blues edged the Flyers 1-0 on Thursday night.

item.description:

item.title: OHL Roundup: MacInnis leads Rangers with three points in 8-1 win over Knights
item.description:
LONDON, Ont. - Ryan MacInnis scored twice and added an assist to power the Kitchener Rangers to an 8-1 win over the London Knights in Ontario Hockey League action Thursday night.
Max Iafrate also had two goals — including one shorthanded goal...

item.title: Erik Karlsson scores twice as red-hot Senators down Canadiens 5-2
item.description:

item.title: Penguins squander huge lead, recover late for 6-4 win over sagging Edmonton
item.description:

item.title: Goligoski, Eakin, and Eaves have goal and assist each in Stars' 5-3 win over Hurricanes
item.description:
RALEIGH, N.C. - Alex Goligoski, Cody Eakin and Patrick Eaves each had a goal and an assist, sparking the Dallas Stars to a 5-3 victory over the Carolina Hurricanes on Thursday night.

item.title: QMJHL Roundup: Waked, Blisle lead Huskies in 5-1 win over Armada
item.description:
BOISBRIAND, Que. - Antoine Waked had a goal and an assist while Jeremy Blisle made 21 saves as the Rouyn-Noranda Huskies downed the Blainville-Boisbriand Armada 5-1 in the lone Quebec Major Junior Hockey League game Thursday night.

item.title: Montreal, Winnipeg moving AHL franchises, OHL team headed to Hamilton
item.description:
The Montreal Canadiens and Winnipeg Jets are moving their American Hockey League affiliates and the Ontario Hockey League's Belleville Bulls will play in Hamilton, Ontario, next season.
Montreal is shifting its AHL team from Hamilton to St. J...

item.title: Rangers' Klein out 3-4 weeks with upper-body injury
item.description:
New York Rangers defenseman Kevin Klein will miss 3-4 weeks because of an upper-body injury, the Rangers announced Thursday.
Klein, who sustained the injury blocking a shot by Alex Ovechkin on Wednesday in a 3-1 win against the Washington Capit...

item.title: Anaheim Ducks send Josh Manson to minors with Vatanen, Beleskey nearing returns from injury
item.description:
ANAHEIM, Calif. - The Anaheim Ducks have reassigned defenceman Josh Manson to the minors with Matt Beleskey and Sami Vatanen nearing return from injury.
The Ducks announced the move Thursday.
Manson has three assists in 28 games with Anahe...

item.title: Sharks' Torres hopes to continue career after surgery
item.description:
SAN JOSE -- San Jose Sharks forward Raffi Torres, two weeks removed from the third major right-knee surgery of his career, said he's encouraged he'll be able to return to the NHL next season.
"Yeah, big-time," Torres said. "I've had a chance to...

item.title: OHL approves relocation and ownership transfer of Belleville Bulls to Hamilton
item.description:
TORONTO - The Belleville Bulls will be moving to Steeltown later this year.
The Ontario Hockey League's Board of Governors approved the relocation of the franchise to Hamilton starting in the 2015-'16 season, the OHL said Thursday in a releas...
